comment.author: 92807080@N00
comment._content: This is a photo of the Ellis Square market in Savanah, Georgia, which opened June 1872 and closed October 1953 to make room for a 199-car public garage. More information about "Old Savanah Market" here: www.geocities.com/midnightinsavannah/thegarden.CityMarket... . Additional images of the Ellis Square market can be seen at the following web pages: www.ci.savannah.ga.us/cityweb/citizensliaison.nsf/48c8783... www.thevillagecraftsmen.com/savannahG88.htm blog.scad.edu/speccoll/exhibits/myrtle-jones-exhibit/ www.judnick.com/GeorgiaSSRAndUSA.htm Anger over the demolition of the old market was a boon to the historic preservation movement in Savannah, however. When the garage’s 50-year lease expired at the end of 2004, the city voted to replace it with a 4-level, 691-space underground garage beneath a restored Ellis Square. The garage was knocked down in 2006 and new construction commenced in 2007. .
